U want the truth about RAR FILES?  Rar is an unstoppable beast that looks like a giant insect.  We are unable to locate the rar exactly but believe it to be somewhere in Tokyo. Every time u extract a rar it feeds the Rar as it is connected to all computers using its special rar abilities.  The more rar it gets the stronger the Rar becomes.  We are part of a secret organization called PAR (ppl against Rar).  We put subliminal messages into no rar movies that tell u to hate rar files, so that u will stop extracting thus feeding the Rar.  This is y u hate rar torrents but don't rly know y.  If u keep extracting rar then the Rar will become too powerful and will awaken from it's slumber, unleashing great rar powers that can only be stopped by zipping the Rar into a great folder then sent to C:/RarWorld back to where the great Rar came from and where other Rars dwell.  If Par can find Rar before this happens then we might just be able to stop the destruction.  Hope is not lost as we now have Nickolas Cage in Par and he wears a wig to strengthen his Cage powers which also doubles as a Rardar (radar that finds Rar).

Asides from all the collective hate from this movie that I had read on here before watching it, Im glad I gave it a chance.  It was a good film in my view, ok it wasnt perfect but Im not going to rant and rave about something I havent paid for, something that kept me watching and something that I know is a lot better than most of the films being made these days.  Nice job jackson, even if it isnt your finest work, we all have different opinions of films and I for one say give it a chance... It is suprisingly dark at times but I know my girlfriend and her family will love this all the same.  Every film in the top 100s comments has some idiot swearing his dick off and ranting hate towards other people.  What is there problem, if I dont like something I dont even bother commenting, I have to much real life stuff to do with my time to spend my energy hating everything online.  Back to my original point... watch the film, its not half bad, i give it a 7/10
